title: Microsoft Office 2016 VL ProPlus Visio Project 64-bit
description:
murphy78 presents MS Office VL 2016 ProPlus/Std w Project, Visio, Proofkit
Contains no updates

Source ISO files:
SW_DVD5_Office_2016_64Bit_English_MLF_X20-42479.ISO
SW_DVD5_Office_Professional_Plus_2016_64Bit_English_MLF_X20-42432.ISO
SW_DVD5_Project_2016_64Bit_English_MLF_X20-42644.ISO
SW_DVD5_Project_Pro_2016_64Bit_English_MLF_X20-42683.ISO
SW_DVD5_Proofing_Tools_2016_64Bit_MultiLang_ComplKit_MLF_X20-42861.ISO
SW_DVD5_Visio_Pro_2016_64Bit_English_MLF_X20-42764.ISO
SW_DVD5_Visio_Std_2016_64Bit_English_MLF_X20-42792.ISO

Release File:
File: Office-2016-VL-ProPlus-Std-Visio-Project-64-bit.iso
Size: 3.28 GB
CRC32: FFFFFFFF*
SHA-1: 8AF3AA80CEFB79AA39E868D77F965FCFC177482F
*Note that auto-crc is easy to fake, so verify sha1 as well.
I've done this as an easy way to detect tampering

Note:
For activation, I've included kms_vl_all 6.6.1
Just extract the 7z file to a directory and run the script.
I've altered the flag for auto-renew to disable the task creation.
If you want to re-enable it, just change the line:

set /a _Task=0
---to---
set /a _Task=1

I've done this on purpose as I don't really want to code an extra
script to uninstall the task and it didn't include one. IMO that's
a bit sloppy, but to each his own. At least the author included a
way to disable it.

Why bother disabling it? Well, CODYQX4 will make a proper version of
MTK2.6 that will handle the activation better, some time in the near future.
There are also a few other tools that you may prefer. Having a task in
your system for a program you no longer use is bad, hence the modding.

I will include links to KMS_VL_ALL project and MTK project in the torrent
directory so you can get the latest or unmodded versions. CODYQX4 will
take longer to make his proper MTK tool, but he always has insanely high
quality on them that typically does not require any updates.

Alternatively there's KMSPico by Heldigard. I <3 Heldigard. Him and I
where the first people to make a pre-activated Win8 release. He is still
one of the most creative tool makers I know of. I'll toss in a link to
the KMSPico page as well.

If you ask me which I'd prefer, I'd say MTK, but I love them all and they
all work as intended, typically. Note that MTK2.6-beta1 currently will
hang up on multiple Office2016 products, so hold off until a newer version.

On the issue of installing specific things, I don't know. You will need
to test the various tools yourself. I will make no claim as often updates
to system may interfere with things like that. It really depends how
futureproof they make the tool.

Credits:
CODYQX4 - Microsoft Toolkit
Heldigard - KMSPico
murphy78 - Testing and ISO design/integration
qewlpal, abbodi1406, and crew - KMS_VL_ALL 6.x

Enjoy,
murph
